ABOUT ( from Futurion.digital ) Jim Van Dyke, Founder and CEO Futurion, is a strategic consultant, technology futurist and expert witness, helping leaders realize the future of digital today.  Mr. Van Dyke also volunteers on the Consumer Advisory Board of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), with focus on fintech.
Javelin Strategy & Research, Greenwich Associates LLC company

Premium provider of future-focused or research-based strategic advisory services to payments, identity, financial services, and digital commerce clients, with particular focus on mobile, security, and consumer-focused emerging capabilities. I managed a team of analysts, market researchers, business development staff and consultants. I started this business in 1998, moved to Jupiter Media Metrix during the dot.com boom, and then returned to Javelin for another 13 year run that culminated with it's sale to Greenwich. Typical clients include global 500 banks, payments processors and brands, as well as online billers and merchants. Javelin's research and consulting methods demonstrate uncanny direction, effort, creativity, relevance and results.

Research Director, managing research operations and client satisfaction within global financial services and payments industry. Managed monthly research deliverables, led forecasts, participated in industry events, managed analyst team from San Francisco office.
Product Director, Internet payemnts encryption and secure messaging

Product manager for the Internet encryption and messaging software/services solution known as Templar. Popularly known as the "VAN (Value Added Network) killer", this disruptive technology offered banks, tech firms, and supply chain operators a way to move their EDI and other data management systems from costly, archaic networks to the Internet. Clients included the worlds largest banks and tech firms. Harbinger acquired Premenos corporation during my tenure (day one, actually).
worked full time while completing degree
Most MBA coursework was completed at Loyola Marymount University
worked full time while completing degree
Most MBA coursework was completed at Loyola Marymount University
Worked near full-time as a supervisor
Worked near full-time as a supervisor

I was on the Consumer Advisory Board for the CFPB, primarily focused on how the fintech revolution creates win-win opportunities for financial institutions, technology providers, and consumers. While many have strong views either in support or opposition to this fast-growing and active federal law enforcement agency, my role is not in any way connected with enforcement. I volunteer for the purpose of realizing the most effective and efficient government oversight possible, within an industry that is vital to prosperity of both companies and individuals. I welcome any specific comments!

summary: I'm a research-based consultant, expert witness and keynote presenter, focus on innovation, strategy, consumer empowerment, the connection between security and identity theft, payments, digital commerce, and financial technology (fintech) innovation. I founded, grew and led Javelin Strategy & Research, now a Greenwich Associates LLC company, and volunteered on the board of the CFPB (Consumer Financial Protection Bureau).  I also started the financial services research practice at Jupiter Research--since acquired by Forrester--and was a product manager for five organizations from startup to Fortune 500. I've been in digital commerce since graduating college, helping merchants, banks and tech providers find or implement ways to succeed. Perhaps you've seen one of my talks or media quotes? I've presented before the US House of Representatives, FDIC, House Ways and Means Committee, countless industry events, and my comments have been covered on TV, radio and print media. My personal passions include sustainable alternative transportation and connecting with new cultures.
name: Jim (James) Van Dyke
title: Research-based strategy consultant, entrepreneur, inventor, volunteer.
